job_details.Vacaturetitel: Software Dev Engineer II, AWS IDEs
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Come join a creative team of software developers dedicated to making it more natural and intuitive to use AWS services from their favorite IDEs. In this position you'll craft high-quality open source software, understand customers, define user experiences and shape the future of IDEs for cloud development.

   You will help us define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful. We are defining new experiences that use generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer. You will interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience. You will analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs. You'll also work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services. And you'll have the opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer.

   Key job responsibilities
   - Define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful.
   - Interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience.
   - Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs.
   - Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services.

   On-Call Responsibility: This position involves On-call responsibility. We work as a team to root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.

   A day in the life
   Work/Life Harmony
   Our team gives high value to work-life harmony. Since the Covid19 pandemic we adjusted to remote work and established a hybrid work environment in which engineers spend 3 days working in the office, adjusted to the team needs.

   Mentorship & Career Growth
   We're committed to the growth and development of every member of the team, and that includes our development managers. As a senior software development engineer you will play a vital part in growing your peers. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction and deliver site-wide initiatives that will improve the life of all of our teams. AWS is a growth environment - we are hiring and scaling rapidly to meet the needs of our customers. You'll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale and will have get to hire & develop other leaders along the way.

   About the team
   When we started building the IDE EDEX team, we set out to create a place where engineers can deliver great work. That means finding and hiring people who value great engineering but who also value professional and personal relationships. We are a global business, so your ability to work with people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds will be important. As software engineers, we need to balance a lot of things. To us, "agile" means balancing software craftsmanship, operational excellence, and delivering value to our customers - while also allowing the team to plan work and life in a predictable way, work hard without needless distractions or fire drills, and spend quality time away from work.

   We take risks, but we hold each other accountable for results and how the results were achieved. We have a long-term vision, but we don't do big designs up front. Our goals are clear and we are working on things that are important to everyone on the team… and to Amazon.
job_details.full_text:
Software Dev Engineer II, AWS IDEs

Come join a creative team of software developers dedicated to making it more natural and intuitive to use AWS services from their favorite IDEs. In this position you'll craft high-quality open source software, understand customers, define user experiences and shape the future of IDEs for cloud development.

   You will help us define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful. We are defining new experiences that use generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer. You will interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience. You will analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs. You'll also work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services. And you'll have the opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer.

   Key job responsibilities
   - Define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful.
   - Interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience.
   - Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs.
   - Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services.

   On-Call Responsibility: This position involves On-call responsibility. We work as a team to root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.

   A day in the life
   Work/Life Harmony
   Our team gives high value to work-life harmony. Since the Covid19 pandemic we adjusted to remote work and established a hybrid work environment in which engineers spend 3 days working in the office, adjusted to the team needs.

   Mentorship & Career Growth
   We're committed to the growth and development of every member of the team, and that includes our development managers. As a senior software development engineer you will play a vital part in growing your peers. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction and deliver site-wide initiatives that will improve the life of all of our teams. AWS is a growth environment - we are hiring and scaling rapidly to meet the needs of our customers. You'll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale and will have get to hire & develop other leaders along the way.

   About the team
   When we started building the IDE EDEX team, we set out to create a place where engineers can deliver great work. That means finding and hiring people who value great engineering but who also value professional and personal relationships. We are a global business, so your ability to work with people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds will be important. As software engineers, we need to balance a lot of things. To us, "agile" means balancing software craftsmanship, operational excellence, and delivering value to our customers - while also allowing the team to plan work and life in a predictable way, work hard without needless distractions or fire drills, and spend quality time away from work.

   We take risks, but we hold each other accountable for results and how the results were achieved. We have a long-term vision, but we don't do big designs up front. Our goals are clear and we are working on things that are important to everyone on the team… and to Amazon.

job_profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on software development within IDEs and enhancing developer productivity using AI tools like CodeWhisperer. However, it lacks specific details on building, fine-tuning, or deploying generative models, which are core to GenAI Engineering. The emphasis is more on the application of AI to improve existing developer workflows rather than core AI model development.

job_tasks.phrase: Define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates understanding the user needs and translating them into product features, aligning with business goals of improving developer experience.

job_tasks.phrase: Interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience.
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding customer needs and translating them into technical requirements for tooling and IDE improvements.

job_tasks.phrase: Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs.
job_tasks.justification: Analyzing data (telemetry) to understand user behavior and needs directly supports business objectives and product development.

job_tasks.phrase: Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services.
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding the needs of other internal teams and aligning technical solutions to meet those needs, contributing to broader business goals.

job_tasks.phrase: We are defining new experiences that use generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer.
job_tasks.justification: Mentions using generative AI and a specific tool (CodeWhisperer) to enhance developer productivity, implying some level of interaction with or understanding of AI models, though not necessarily building them.
This is a direct indicator of software development activities.

job_tasks.phrase: shape the future of IDEs for cloud development.
job_tasks.justification: Implies designing and building new features or systems for IDEs, which falls under software development.

job_tasks.phrase: root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.
job_tasks.justification: This describes operational responsibilities related to system maintenance, resilience, and fault tolerance, which are aspects of MLOps or general SRE.

job_tasks.phrase: ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.
job_tasks.justification: Focuses on the operational aspects of maintaining and ensuring the reliability of systems.

technologies.justification: CodeWhisperer is a generative AI coding companion, fitting the category of Generative Models.

soft_skills.justification: Highlights creativity as a valued trait for team members.
Emphasizes the importance of understanding user needs and perspectives.
Focuses on translating user needs into tangible product features and interactions.

soft_skills.phrase: Interact with Amazon developers all over the world
soft_skills.justification: Requires communication and collaboration with a diverse, global group of stakeholders.

soft_skills.phrase: learn and grow as an engineer
soft_skills.justification: Indicates a focus on continuous learning and professional development.
Refers to balancing professional responsibilities with personal life, a key aspect of team culture and collaboration.
Highlights a proactive role in developing peers and contributing to team growth, indicating ownership and leadership.

soft_skills.phrase: play a vital part in growing your peers
soft_skills.justification: Suggests taking initiative and responsibility for the development of others.

soft_skills.phrase: contribute to the culture and direction
soft_skills.justification: Implies taking ownership and influencing the team's trajectory and environment.

soft_skills.phrase: work with people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds
soft_skills.justification: Directly addresses the need for effective collaboration with diverse teams.

soft_skills.phrase: balancing software craftsmanship, operational excellence, and delivering value to our customers
soft_skills.justification: Demonstrates a pragmatic approach to problem-solving, balancing multiple priorities to achieve results.

soft_skills.phrase: take risks, but we hold each other accountable for results
soft_skills.justification: Indicates a culture of ownership, accountability, and a willingness to innovate.
Suggests strategic thinking and planning as part of problem-solving.
